headline: Nvidia earnings, Fed minutes, MBS visit: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, November 19, including earnings results from companies like Nvidia (NVDA), Target (TGT), and Lowe's (LOW); the release of the Federal Reserve's October FOMC meeting minutes; and the second day of Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's trip to Washington D.C., where an US,-Saudi Arabia investment forum will see the attendance of several top CEOs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: Nvidia earnings, Fed minutes, MBS visit: What to Watch

headline: Palo Alto Networks and IBM Plan to Launch Joint Solution to Accelerate Enterprise-Wide Quantum-Safe Readiness
summary: As the path toward large-scale, fault-tolerant quantum computing rapidly accelerates, enterprises must act now to secure their data. To provide a path to a quantum-safe future, Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ: PANW) today announced a plan with IBM to offer a new Quantum-Safe Readiness solution designed to help enterprises identify cryptographic exposure, understand quantum-computing related risks, and accelerate their transition toward quantum-safe security.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks and IBM Plan to Launch Joint Solution to Accelerate Enterprise-Wide Quantum-Safe Readiness
content.summary: As the path toward large-scale, fault-tolerant quantum computing rapidly accelerates, enterprises must act now to secure their data. To provide a path to a quantum-safe future, Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ: PANW) today announced a plan with IBM to offer a new Quantum-Safe Readiness solution designed to help enterprises identify cryptographic exposure, understand quantum-computing related risks, and accelerate their transition toward quantum-safe security.

headline: Dow Jones Futures Rise As Nvidia Earnings Lift AI Stocks; Jobs Report, Walmart Due
summary: Dow Jones futures rose after hours, along with S&P 500 futures and especially Nasdaq futures. Nvidia climbed in a buy zone late on strong earnings and guidance, also lifting Broadcom, Taiwan Semiconductor, Advanced Micro Devices and the broader AI ecosystem.

headline: Palo Alto Networks’s (NASDAQ:PANW) Q3 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
summary: Cybersecurity platform provider Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ:PANW) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 15.7% year on year to $2.47 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $2.58 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.93 per share was 4.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates. Palo Alto Networks also announced its intent to acquire Chronosphere, a next-generation observability platform for the data center era.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks’s (NASDAQ:PANW) Q3 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
content.summary: Cybersecurity platform provider Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ:PANW) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 15.7% year on year to $2.47 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $2.58 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.93 per share was 4.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates. Palo Alto Networks also announced its intent to acquire Chronosphere, a next-generation observability platform for the data center era.

headline: Palo Alto: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 16 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 89 cents per share. The security software maker posted revenue of $2.47 billion in the period, also surpassing Street forecasts. Fifteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $2.46 billion.

content.title: Palo Alto: Fiscal Q1 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: The average estimate of 16 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 89 cents per share. The security software maker posted revenue of $2.47 billion in the period, also surpassing Street forecasts. Fifteen analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $2.46 billion.

headline: Palo Alto Networks Appoints Mark Goodburn to Board of Directors; Announces Retirement of Director Mary Pat McCarthy
summary: Palo Alto Networks® (NASDAQ: PANW), the global cybersecurity leader, today announced the appointment of Mark Goodburn to the company's board of directors. The company also announced the retirement of Mary Pat McCarthy, one of its longest-serving board members, effective January 23, 2026.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks Appoints Mark Goodburn to Board of Directors; Announces Retirement of Director Mary Pat McCarthy
content.summary: Palo Alto Networks® (NASDAQ: PANW), the global cybersecurity leader, today announced the appointment of Mark Goodburn to the company's board of directors. The company also announced the retirement of Mary Pat McCarthy, one of its longest-serving board members, effective January 23, 2026.

headline: Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Chronosphere, Next-Gen Observability Leader, for the AI Era
summary: Furthering its mission to address the critical data demands of the AI era, Palo Alto Networks® (NASDAQ: PANW), the global cybersecurity leader, today announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Chronosphere, a next-generation observability platform built to scale for the AI era. This acquisition will strengthen Palo Alto Networks' ability to help organizations navigate a world where modern applications and AI workloads demand a unified data and security foundation.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Chronosphere, Next-Gen Observability Leader, for the AI Era
content.summary: Furthering its mission to address the critical data demands of the AI era, Palo Alto Networks® (NASDAQ: PANW), the global cybersecurity leader, today announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Chronosphere, a next-generation observability platform built to scale for the AI era. This acquisition will strengthen Palo Alto Networks' ability to help organizations navigate a world where modern applications and AI workloads demand a unified data and security foundation.

headline: Palo Alto to buy Chronosphere for $3.35 billion
summary: Palo Alto  (PANW)​ said on ‌Wednesday it will buy ‌cloud management and monitoring company Chronosphere for $3.35 ⁠billion, ‌as the cybersecurity firm looks ‍to strengthen its AI offerings.

content.title: Palo Alto to buy Chronosphere for $3.35 billion
content.summary: Palo Alto  (PANW)​ said on ‌Wednesday it will buy ‌cloud management and monitoring company Chronosphere for $3.35 ⁠billion, ‌as the cybersecurity firm looks ‍to strengthen its AI offerings.

headline: Palo Alto Networks to buy Chronosphere for $3.35 billion, raises annual forecasts
summary: The Santa Clara,‌ California-based company plans to integrate Chronosphere with Cortex AgentiX platform, allowing use of its AI agents on the cloud management firm's data to detect performance issues ⁠and autonomously investigate ‌their root cause.  Palo Alto will pay the deal amount in cash and new equity to ‍substitute old awards.  Separately, Palo Alto raised its ​annual revenue and profit forecasts on expectations of a ‌surge in demand for its cybersecurity solutions to tackle rising online threats.

content.title: Palo Alto Networks to buy Chronosphere for $3.35 billion, raises annual forecasts
content.summary: The Santa Clara,‌ California-based company plans to integrate Chronosphere with Cortex AgentiX platform, allowing use of its AI agents on the cloud management firm's data to detect performance issues ⁠and autonomously investigate ‌their root cause.  Palo Alto will pay the deal amount in cash and new equity to ‍substitute old awards.  Separately, Palo Alto raised its ​annual revenue and profit forecasts on expectations of a ‌surge in demand for its cybersecurity solutions to tackle rising online threats.
